title: Ticket #4437: Shadow does not initialize supplemental groups properly
description:
Hi,

User log files are failing to initialize due to the shadow not initializing supplemental groups properly.

This error was first observed on version 8.1.4 

[nvanlysel@opt-submit discoveryit]$ condor_version
$CondorVersion: 8.1.4 Feb 25 2014 BuildID: 230990 $
$CondorPlatform: x86_64_RedHat6 $

and was also observed on version 8.2.1 

[nvanlysel@submit-2 ~]$ condor_version
$CondorVersion: 8.2.1 Jun 28 2014 BuildID: 256314 $
$CondorPlatform: x86_64_RedHat5 $

Here are the groups that I belong to: 

[nvanlysel@submit-2 ~]$ id
uid=20705(nvanlysel) gid=20706(nvanlysel) groups=20705(discoveryit),20706(nvanlysel)

Here's the directory where I'm submitting jobs from: 

[nvanlysel@submit-2 ~]$ pwd
/test/discoveryit/home/nvanlysel

Here are the directory permissions:

drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 Jul  2 13:16 /test

remarks:
2014-Jul-15 14:54:53 by jfrey:
This is a bug in the shadow where it tries to re-initialize the UID/GID of the job owner while in the user priv-state when opening the user log. This causes the supplemental groups to be unset.

2014-Aug-06 17:00:09 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Patch looks good for stable series, resolving. However, would like to see a follow-up ticket on master branch that adds some EXCEPTS in the priv sep code to prevent this land-mine from being stepped on again from a different call site.
